newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: WEEK AHEAD-Markets seen on hold as rate cut talk continues.
newsitem.headline: WEEK AHEAD-Markets seen on hold as rate cut talk continues.

text.p: Australian financial markets are likely to be fairly subdued this week with only a few minor economic releases and ahead of key inflation and wages data the following week.

As this data is widely expected to be supportive of a rate cut, the market should remain bullish through the week, with minor price indicators on Monday and Tuesday expected to paint a picture of subdued inflation pressures.
The data the following week is expected to give the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) a good news platform on which to announce a rate cut.
